moves.1. c4:
White played English opening. It is one of the most popular openings.
Making room for his Q and controlling the important W sq d5.
moves.1... e5:
Black puts a pawn in the center.
Controls 2 dark sqs d4 and f4 and opens diagonals for Q and B.
moves.2. Nc3:
Nice developing move, attacking central white squares.
One of the good things about English opening is that c pawn is not locked by the N.
moves.3. g3: g3 so white can place B on g2 to put more pressure on white squares.
moves.3... Bb4: Clearing the way for castling and putting some pressure on white queen side.
moves.4... Nc6:
Another development, but bad thing N has blocked the c pawn.
0-0 is better. Then d6 and later Nbd7.
moves.5. e4:
Gaining space and occupying the important white square.
Long diagonal is blocked.
moves.7. Nge2:
Supporting QN.
Nf3 blocks the f pawn.
moves.7... a5:
Perhaps a mistake.
... a6 seems better.
moves.8. O-O Bc5: Pinning f pawn and further controlling d4 sq.
moves.9. Bg5:
Developing and pinning.
White's plan is to play Nd5 then capturing on f6, breaking the king side.
moves.9... h6: Putting question to the B. Blk wanted to resolve the pressure on his castled position.
moves.10. Be3:
White did'nt give up his important B for the N.
if BxN QxB
  Nd5 Qd8
i think blk pos is fine.
moves.12. Qd2:
Defence.
Q is unguarded. Perhaps Qc1 was better.
moves.13. Rf3:
Defence.
Also planning to double the Rs by Raf1.
moves.14. exd4:
Blunder.
NxN was the correct move.
moves.14... Qxd2:
Winning the Q. Black is 6 points ahead in material.
White resigned.
In this game I controlled and occupied many dark squares.
Thanks for watching the game.
Please leave suggestions and comments.
Regards.
